#id=1
#text=If you have a flat tire it is quite easy to change it yourself .
#id=2
#text=The front tire is the easiest to change while the back will require more time and maybe additional tools .
#id=3
#text=This is usually the back tire is where the chain and gears are connected to so it is harder to take off the bike frame .
#id=4
#text=Sadly , most of the time a flat tire is the back tire because the back tire supports most of your weight on a bicycle .
#id=5
#text=So you 'll need a wrench to undo the bolts on both sides of the tire .
#id=6
#text=This will allow you to take off the entire tire .
#id=7
#text=Inside the tire is an innertube , and this is the part you either need to replace or patch up .
#id=8
#text=If it is a small hole and you can easily find the hole , you can use a tire patch kit to fix the hole .
#id=9
#text=Other wise you may just replace the entire innertube altogether .
#text=Either way you will put the innertube back , and then the tire back onto the bike frame .
#text=Lastly , screw back on the bolts and pump some air into the tire .
#text=You 'll be ready to ride soon after !
